snippet: Researchers in Australia say they have developed a coating technique that is quick, cheap and natural and can be used on a diverse range of substances.
abstract: Researchers report in journal Science that they have developed thin, nontoxic coating that can be applied to microscopic objects using iron ions and a natural polyphenol known as tannic acid; technique is quicker and cheaper than previous ones and has wide array of potential applications in medicine and environmental science.
lead_paragraph: Researchers in Australia say they have developed a coating technique that is quick, cheap and natural and can be used on a diverse range of substances.

headline.print_headline: Material Science: Slipping on a Coat With Ease
headline.main: New Coating Technique for Microscopic Objects
